Hace veintisiete aos que Ismael Vias vive en el exilio. Su nombre ha ido poco a poco desvanecindose, desapareciendo de la vida pblica. Diana Hunter cuenta apenas con algunas referencias; indicios. Sabe que naci poco despus de los fusilamientos de la Patagonia, un glido 22 de mayo de 1925. Su padre haba sido el juez letrado designado por el Presidente Irigoyen para intervenir en el asunto de las huelgas que acabaran en tragedia. A diferencia de su hermano David, una figura pblicamente reconocida, poco y nada se sabe del primognito. Sus ensayos y artculos han corrido la misma suerte que su nombre, sus poesas y sus compaeros de militancia. Todo parece disiparse poco despus de que se desatara el terror, durante el tercer gobieo peronista (1973-1976). Desde entonces Vias vive fuera de su pas. A pesar de la distancia Hunter consigue, junto a su cmara, burlar el destierro y el olvido concedindole al viejo patriarca la posibilidad de imponer los trminos de un regreso virtual.

ENGLISH VERSION

For the last twenty-seven years, Ismael Vias has lived in exile. Little by little, his name has vanished from public life. Diana Hunter's research relied on a limited pool of available information. The filmmaker knew that he was bo shortly after the mass executions in Patagonia on May 22, 1925. His father was a Judge appointed by President Irigoyen to resolve a labor strike which subsequently ended in tragedy. Unlike David, his youngest brother, a public figure, very little is known about Ismael. His essays and articles have suffered the same fate as his name, his poems and his militant companions of a bygone era. All references to him seem to have dissipated shortly after the outbreak of terror, during the third Peronist regime (1973-1976). Since then, Ismael Vias has lived in exile. But in spite of the distance and the forgetfulness granted to this old patriarch, Diana Hunter, with the complicity of her camera, has succeeded in chronicling his personal saga and heralding his virtual retu.
